content: before marker 1 round 3 k2tog k1 slip marker 1 and work across the front of your sock in pattern slip marker 2 k1 ssk k to marker 1 repeat round 2 no decreases and round 3 with decreases until you have 60 stitches in total foot continue along the foot knitting 29 instep stitches in pattern and 31 in plain stockinette for the underside of the foot ending with row 4 when you are around 3cm 1¼in from your required foot length page 4 forest of firs socks www blueammonitedesigns com toe work a standard round toe as follows each round is one row worked on both needles rounds 1 & 2 knit round 3 *k4 k2tog* for whole round 50 sts remaining rounds 4 & 5 knit round 6 *k3 k2tog* for whole round 40 sts remaining rounds 7 & 8 knit round 9 *k2 k2tog* for whole round 30 sts remaining rounds 10 & 11 knit round 12 *k1 k2tog* for whole round 20 sts remaining rounds 13 & 14 knit round 15 k2tog for whole round 10 sts remaining round 16 k2tog for whole round 5 sts remaining finishing cut your yarn using a needle thread the end of your yarn through the remaining toe stitches then pull tight to cinch them together thread the yarn through the centre of the little circle you ve created and weave into the underside of the toe weave the loose yarn for your cuff inside your ribbing congratulations your forest of firs sock is now complete just make one more give them soak and block to even out the stitches then they re good to go enjoy we love to see our kits and patterns out in the wild if you share pictures of your trellis socks or other blue ammonite projects please tag us on @blue_ammonite and use hashtag #blueammonitedesigns you ll make our day would you like a free pattern or £5 off your next order just sign up to our monthly newsletter and receive details of new crochet and knitting kits or patterns plus exclusive discounts for subscribers www blueammonitedesigns com page 5 forest of firs socks www blueammonitedesigns com
